vscode-pipe.createNewFile.markdownDescription: If true, will create a new file with the name specified in `vscode-pipe.outputFileName`. Otherwise will pipe the output to wherever the cursor is on currently open file.

vscode-pipe.outputFileName.markdownDescription: Not applicable if `vscode-pipe.createNewFile` is disabled. Specifies the name of file, where the output from command is piped to. This file will be created in the same directory as currently open file.

vscode-pipe.shellRelativePwd.markdownDescription: Specifies the directory, where the shell command will be executed. By default, shell process will start from the `fileDirPath`, i.e. the directory in which current file is opened. When using this setting, remember that this path is relative to `fileDirPath` and must start with a `/`. For example, `/..` or `/../` will start the shell from current file's parent directory. Try using `ls` or `pwd` commands with different paths to get a feel for it.
